channel.title: Presidential Election of 2008
channel.description: News about the presidential election of 2008. Commentary and archival information about the presidential election of 2008 from The New York Times.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2017 The New York Times Company

item.title: 2008 | Reince Priebus Predicts Wisconsin Will Go Red
item.description: Donald J. Trump’s newly minted chief of staff was dead wrong in 2008 — but his predictions may have proved prescient in 2016.
item.author: By STEPHEN HILTNER

item.title: A Newly Vibrant Washington Fears That Trump Will Drain Its Culture
item.description: President Obama’s arrival in Washington coincided with an urban renaissance, an influx of young people and an explosion in restaurants. Many there worry that Mr. Trump will set the city back.
item.author: By JASON HOROWITZ

item.title: Earthquake and Aftershock: The Elections of 2008 and 2016
item.description: If 2008 was an emblem of progress as America elected its first black president, 2016 has required the grim acceptance of limits, disappointments and blind spots.
item.author: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER

item.title: An Unfinished Presidency: Obama Passes the Baton
item.description: As the nation prepares to choose President Obama’s successor, the bold agenda he described eight years ago remains incomplete.
item.author: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR

item.title: 2008 Was a Celebration. 2016 Is the Opposite.
item.description: Now it’s eight years later, at the end of a revolution that has not yet happened.
item.author: By KAITLYN GREENIDGE

item.title: Want to Know the Crucial Areas for Clinton? Follow Michelle Obama
item.description: The popular first lady, who limits her campaign appearances, is being dispatched to places and constituencies where the campaign is facing the greatest pressure.
item.author: By AMY CHOZICK

item.title: Candidate Obama Kept His Promise to Native Americans
item.description: Although some issues are unsettled, the president has done a commendable job of serving the American Indian community.
item.author: By THE EDITORIAL BOARD

item.title: Red States, Blue States: 2016 Is Looking a Lot Like 2012 (and 2008)
item.description: If Upshot predictions for each state prove correct, 2016’s Electoral College map will resemble 2012’s in every way — except for North Carolina.
item.author: By TONI MONKOVIC

item.title: On the Campaign Trail, Love Doesn’t Always Win
item.description: It is not unusual for the aides of candidates to find romance on the road, but rare for it to last.
item.author: By TAMMY La GORCE

item.title: Thanks, Obama
item.description: The Audacity of Hope has downshifted to the Banality of Practicality.
item.author: By MAUREEN DOWD
